title: Natural farming working model | Sustainable Farming | Hydroponic&Vertical farming | Organic manure

tasks.task: Growing crops using hydroponic systems and traditional farming methods.
subtasks: Understanding different types of national forming (hydroponic and Adromalacharya).
Learning about the history and development of hydroponic farming.
Explaining the dripping system and its benefits for plant watering.
Demonstrating the use of manure mix and ironing acanolite to improve water flow.
Describing the use of panchagalaya as a natural fertilizer and its benefits.
Explaining the process of preparing panchagalaya using fruit, seeds, and ghee.
Discussing self-watering systems and how to implement them.
Highlighting the importance of vertical farming and its environmental benefits.
Promoting the use of eco-friendly farming practices among small and marginal farmers.
Setting up hydroponic plants.
Using water-dripping systems for consistent watering.
Adding clean soil and nutrients manually to the hydroponic system.
Mixing organic and fresh manure.
Applying liquid water and manure sprays to plants.
Collecting and decomposing fruit, seeds, and ghee for panchagalaya.
Mixing decomposed materials to create panchagalaya.
Using panchagalaya as a natural fertilizer.
Implementing self-watering systems with boxes and absorbent materials.

tasks.task: Advancing agricultural practices for environmental sustainability.
subtasks: Encouraging the adoption of hydroponic and vertical farming techniques.
Reducing dependence on chemical inputs through natural fertilizers and methods.
Educating farmers about the benefits of eco-friendly agriculture.
Supporting small and marginal farmers in adopting sustainable practices.

tasks.task: Growing crops using hydroponic systems and traditional farming methods.

The transcript mentions "National Forming" and various farming practices. It’s all about agriculture and cultivation methods. So all the mentioned tasks are related to physical farming activities. Therefore, I need to list several MAINTASKs and their subtasks as per the discussion above.
